result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dwayne Spikes

defendant.name: Spikes, Dwayne
defendant.address: 10407 W Greenfield Avenue #1, West Allis, WI 53214

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dwayne Spikes not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Rakestraw has been appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Dwayne Spikes appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Arthur Kenneth Thexton in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for status of counsel. SPD has not appointed. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for status of counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dwayne Spikes not in court, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. State's Witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Case is adjourned. Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE for Status of Counsel.
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY with breathalyzer tests.
  Court ordered random drug testing.
  No possession of any controlled substance without a valid prescription.

Defendant Dwayne Spikes in court with attorney William Scott Nelson.  Defendant Dwayne Spikes in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 30, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant. ($750.00) LW
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 750.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Dwayne Spikes not in court.   No Assistant District Attorney Available appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/23/2022@1p
